meanings.definition: A mathematical object used to describe the intrinsic angular momentum of particles.
meanings.sent1: In quantum mechanics, spinors help us understand how particles spin.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use spinors to study the rotation of tiny particles.
meanings.sent3: The spinors at the math party were always spinning around in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like spinors, constantly rotating and changing direction.
meanings.sent5: The concept of spinors can be tricky, but imagine tiny spinning arrows to help visualize it.

meanings.definition: A type of mathematical object that transforms under rotations in a non-trivial way.
meanings.sent1: When you rotate the coordinate system, spinors transform uniquely.
meanings.sent2: Spinors exhibit interesting changes when the frame of reference is rotated.
meanings.sent3: The spinors in the math problem decided to do a little dance when rotated.
meanings.sent4: His ideas about the universe were like spinors, shifting and transforming unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing spinors as little dancers twirling gracefully can help grasp their transformation properties.
